# unlock(completionHandler:)

**Instance Method**

Allows the user to make modifications to the document.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func unlock(completionHandler: ((Bool) -> Void)? = nil)
```

```swift
@MainActor func unlock() async -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **completionHandler**: The completion handler block object passed in to be invoked after unlocking is completed, regardless of success or failure.

## Discussion

By default, this method invokes the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/unlock(completionHandler:)-6m7rh] method to unlock the document. This method disables autosaving safety checking, meaning that [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/checkAutosavingSafety()] will no longer be invoked on this document. When unlocking succeeds, the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/isLocked] method will begin returning [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Locking the Document

- **lock(_:)**: Locks the document in response to the user choosing the Lock menu item.
- **unlock(_:)**: Unlocks the document in response to the user choosing the Unlock menu item.
- **lock(completionHandler:)**: Prevents the user from making further changes to the document.
- **lock(completionHandler:)**: Prevents the user from making changes to the document’s file.
- **unlock(completionHandler:)**: Allows the user to make modifications to the document’s file.
- **isLocked**: A Boolean value that indicates whether or not the file can be written to.
